title: How to use the law of excluded middle - Quora

response.answer_text: The law of excluded middle, is that something is either true or false - there is no middle ground, no degrees of truth, no quantum state, etc … Correct use: A real number is rational or irrational. if we can prove a real number can’t be written as fraction, we’ve proven it’s an irrational number. Inccorrect use: Someone is either good or bad. Shrodingers cat is either dead or alive. Either the iron hand of tyrrany or anarchy.

The law of excluded middle tells us that they are only two possibilities with respect to a statement P . Either P is true , or ^P is true . In showing that the assumptions of ^P leads to a contradictory conclusion , we eliminate the possibility that ^P is true.

I think its usage for everyday problems in life, if that is what you are seeking. Can be translated with Occams Razor. “The simplest explanation is most often the correct one.” Keep in mind the substance of common sense. “There are many solutions to one problem, best solutions avoid more problems.” Also concerning sense in general: desire depletes sense; sense depletes desire.
